text: is anyone still having issues with CTAs not loading when its embedded into a non HS site?
it's a cta being loaded from the `<http://cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com|cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com>` domain.
working for me here on various HS-enabled WordPress sites, but I also manually updated the lists

i found one entry on this <https://easylist.to/easylist/easylist.txt> that shows the hs-cta-wrapper but im not sure if it relates directly to the domain listed next to it a general id. I know nothing on how the adblockers work
That entry only blocks it for CTAs embedded on the domain <http://blog.recruitifi.com|blog.recruitifi.com>
Can you confirm which adblocker you're using, AJ?
<@U24DCSJBE> you were correct in that my adblock list wasnt updated yet so i didnt see the change.
:+1: we're under the impression that they're automatically updated every 24 hours, so we'd expect to see no more reports of issues by 9PM (GMT) today

since we are on the topic of adblocking / tracking code blocking. does anyone know if firefox quantum's new out of the box blocking affects HubSpot / google analytics or other trackers that we typically use?

From our testing, HubSpot analytics and google analytics are both blocked by the out of the box settings (but only in private browsing mode). There's a toggle to enable blocking for normal browsing modes, that'd mean GA and HS Analytics are blocked
If you enable their "Strict protection" mode, CTAs and Forms don't load, but that's something that'll get much better as we work to move to a first-party asset hosting
That'll be a big win, for a few reasons, but on top of this it means the number of 3rd party requests coming from HS sites plummets
is there anyway to use HubSpots personalization or smart content on a wordpress site?
I know Pardot's smart content is a separate module and allows them to embed that content so it can be used on external sites but I am not seeing a way to do this in a WP site
You can use it in HubSpot CTAs that are embedded in external sites (as long as it has the tracking code installed), but for regular content it's not possible.
